result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Renk

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM Defendant Nicole M Renk in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Nicole M Renk.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court informs the parties that if the Preliminary Hearing is contested that the parties will need to set this with the assigned Judge on a date other than the Preliminary Hearing dates. 

Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 3

Do not possess/consume alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:44 PM Defendant Nicole M Renk appeared by video, in custody. Assistant District Attorney ADA) Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is   eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
